content: I am a cse graduate pursuing Mtech RA (Research Associate) at Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad. My research areas include Blockchains, SDN, Applied crytography and ZKP techniques.

content: Anish Hirwe received the M.Tech. degree from the Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, India, in 2012, in computer science and engineering. Currently, he is pursuing Ph.D. degree with Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad, India. His research interest spans the domain of Network Function Virtualization, Software Defined Networking, Network Validation, and Passive optical network.
summary: Anish Hirwe received the M.Tech. degree from the Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, India, in 2012, in computer science and engineering. Currently, he is pursuing Ph.D. degree with Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad, India.

content: Devansh Agarwal is currently working as an SDE in Amazon. He has graduated from IIT Hyderabad and was awarded the Instituite Silver medal for securing the highest CGPA in his department. He was part of the team that developed and launched India’s first VR product for architecture. Currently his research work includes Neural Architecture Search and robustness of Neural Networks.
summary: Devansh Agarwal is currently working as an SDE in Amazon. He has graduated from IIT Hyderabad and was awarded the Instituite Silver medal for securing the highest CGPA in his department.

content: Kotaro Kataoka is an Associate Professor at Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad as well as a Senior Researcher at Keio Research Institute at SFC. He has been a member of Asian Internet Interconnection Initiatives (AI3) project and Widely Integrated Distributed Environment (WIDE) project for research on Satellite Internet, Post-Disaster Networking and etc. He also served as an Expert in JICA FRIENDSHIP Project for facilitating Indo-Japan collaborations between 2012 and 2019.
summary: Kotaro Kataoka is an Associate Professor at Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad as well as a Senior Researcher at Keio Research Institute at SFC. He has been a member of Asian Internet Interconnection Initiatives (AI3) project and Widely Integrated Distributed Environment (WIDE) project for research on Satellite Internet, Post-Disaster Networking and etc.
title: Kotaro Kataoka

content: Maria Francis is an Assistant Professor at the Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad. Previously, she was a postdoctoral researcher at the Institute for Algebra at the Johannes Kepler University (JKU), Linz, Austria where she worked under the supervision of Prof. Manuel Kauers. Prior to that, she was a doctoral student at the Computer Science and Automation department at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bangalore, India. During the period 2007 - 2009, she had worked with Microsoft India (R &D) as a Program Manager.

title: Maria Francis

content:
Nelson Bighetti is a professor of artificial intelligence at the Stanford AI Lab. His research interests include distributed robotics, mobile computing and programmable matter. He leads the Robotic Neurobiology group, which develops self-reconfiguring robots, systems of self-organizing robots, and mobile sensor networks.

content: Praveen Tammana is an Assistant Professor at Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad. Prior to IITH, he was a Postdoctoral researcher with Prof. Jennifer Rexford and Prof. David Walker, Computer Science, Princeton University. His research interests are at the intersection of Systems, Networking, and Security, and Machine Learning. Currently, his focus is on designing networks to make network management easier using exciting emerging technologies such as Software-Defined Networking (SDN) and P4-based programmable data planes.
